caption:
In the photograph, the primary focus is a large, weathered yellow sign that reads "For INFORMATION ABOUT THIS LAND See GARFIELD OIL-LAND & DEVELOPMENT, INC. 719 GRAND AVE. GLENWOOD SPRINGS, COLO." The sign is supported by wooden posts and surrounded by pieces of scrap wood and debris on the ground, indicating a somewhat undeveloped or neglected area.

The background of the image features a desolate, hilly landscape with sparse vegetation, primarily small bushes and scrub. The hills are rocky and barren, typical of a semi-arid region. The sky is partly cloudy, suggesting an overcast day.

There is a dirt road that runs parallel and close to the sign, though no vehicles or people are visible in the image. The overall composition of the photograph suggests a remote, undeveloped region, possibly being advertised for oil and land development purposes. The setting appears quiet and uninhabited, emphasizing the isolation and undeveloped nature of the land.
title: Land development advertising in Rocky Mountains
